title: Warning Against Adultery
shortSummary: Proverbs 7 presents a vivid parental warning against the dangers of adultery and seduction, emphasizing the importance of adhering to wisdom and God's commandments. Through a detailed narrative, the chapter illustrates the destructive consequences of yielding to temptation and the value of guarding one's heart and mind.
timeline: Traditionally attributed to Solomon, c. 10th century BC

keyCharacters.name: The Father
keyCharacters.description: The speaker who instructs his son to embrace wisdom and avoid the seduction of the adulterous woman.

keyCharacters.name: The Son
keyCharacters.description: The young man who is warned to keep God's commandments and avoid the path of folly represented by the strange woman.

keyCharacters.name: The Strange Woman
keyCharacters.description: A seductive and deceitful woman who entices the young man into sin, symbolizing temptation and moral danger.

definitions.definition: A term used in Proverbs to describe a foreign or adulterous woman who leads men away from righteousness.
An expression meaning something or someone cherished above all else; the pupil of the eye, signifying preciousness.
Sacrificial offerings made in the Old Testament as a sign of fellowship and thanksgiving to God.
A metaphor for the grave or hell, representing eternal separation from God as a consequence of sin.

outline.heading: Exhortation to Embrace Wisdom and Guard Against Temptation
outline.description: The father urges his son to keep God's commandments closely, likening wisdom and understanding to close relatives who protect him from the seductive dangers of the strange woman.

outline.heading: Observation of the Young Man’s Folly
outline.description: The father describes watching from his window as a naive young man, lacking understanding, approaches the house of the adulterous woman at night.

outline.heading: The Seduction by the Strange Woman
outline.description: The woman, characterized by boldness and deceit, entices the young man with flattering words and promises of pleasure, leading him blindly to destruction.

outline.heading: Final Warning and Consequences
outline.description: The father calls out to all children to heed his warning, emphasizing the deadly consequences of following the adulterous woman, whose path leads to death and destruction.

application: Memorize and meditate on God’s commandments daily to guard your heart against temptation.
Recognize and avoid situations or influences that may lead to moral compromise or sin.
Seek wisdom and understanding as close companions to protect you from the snares of the enemy.
Be vigilant in prayer and accountability to resist the allure of sinful desires.

keyVerses.text: Keep my commandments, and live; and my law as the apple of thine eye.
keyVerses.significance: This verse underscores the vital importance of valuing and obeying God's commandments as essential for life.

keyVerses.text: With her much fair speech she caused him to yield, with the flattering of her lips she forced him.
keyVerses.significance: It highlights how seductive words can overpower reason and lead to sinful choices.

keyVerses.text: Her house is the way to hell, going down to the chambers of death.
keyVerses.significance: A solemn warning that the path of sin leads to eternal separation from God and spiritual death.
